FTSE 100 Set to Fall as Tariff Worries Hit Stocks

items.standfirst: LONDON — European stocks are expected to open sharply lower on Monday as traders react to U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to hike tariffs on a number of European countries if they oppose his bid to buy Greenland. The U.K.'s FTSE index is seen opening 0.5% lower, Germany's DAX 1.23% lower,…

items.title: S. Korea, Taiwan Lead EM Asia Stocks Higher, Reversing Greenland Tariff Worries
items.standfirst: Emerging Asian equities gained, led by South Korea and Taiwan, helping reverse early declines fueled by US President Donald Trump’s announcement of new tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland.
items.content: Emerging Asian equities gained, led by South Korea and Taiwan, helping reverse early declines fueled by US President Donald Trump’s announcement of new tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland.

items.title: Live: EU leaders to meet 'in coming days' to discuss US tariffs over Greenland
items.standfirst: EU leaders will meet “in the coming days” to coordinate their response on Greenland following US President Donald Trump's threats of tariffs, European Council President Antonio Costa announced on Sunday. Trump has insisted he will settle for nothing less than ownership of Denmark's autonomous territory. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.
items.content: EU leaders will meet “in the coming days” to coordinate their response on Greenland following US President Donald Trump's threats of tariffs, European Council President Antonio Costa announced on Sunday. Trump has insisted he will settle for nothing less than ownership of Denmark's autonomous territory. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

items.title: Europeans reeling from Trump threat to impose tariffs on 8 countries
items.standfirst: Europeans were reeling Sunday from President Trump's announcement​ that eight countries will face a 10% tariff for opposing American control of Greenland.

items.title: EU considers retaliatory measures over Trump Greenland tariff ‘blackmail’
items.standfirst: Emmanuel Macron calls on fellow leaders to use powerful anti-coercion instrument if US goes ahead with tariffsThe EU was weighing up retaliatory tariffs on American goods and even deploying its most serious economic sanctions against the US as European leaders lined up to criticise Donald Trump’s threat to levy new taxes on imports from eight nations who oppose his attempt to annex Greenland – which one minister called “blackmail”.“Tariff threats undermine transatlantic relations and risk a dangerous downward spiral,” the leaders of Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the UK, the Netherlands and Finland said in a joint statement. “We are committed to upholding our sovereignty.” Continue reading...
items.content: Emmanuel Macron calls on fellow leaders to use powerful anti-coercion instrument if US goes ahead with tariffsThe EU was weighing up retaliatory tariffs on American goods and even deploying its most serious economic sanctions against the US as European leaders lined up to criticise Donald Trump’s threat to levy new taxes on imports from eight nations who oppose his attempt to annex Greenland – which one minister called “blackmail”.“Tariff threats undermine transatlantic relations and risk a dangerous downward spiral,” the leaders of Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the UK, the Netherlands and Finland said in a joint statement. “We are committed to upholding our sovereignty.” Continue reading...

items.title: European leaders denounce Trump's tariff threat over Greenland
items.standfirst: European countries held an emergency meeting in Brussels Sunday in response to President Trump's post threatening tariffs against countries that have sent military forces into Greenland amid his push to annex the Arctic island. Leigh Kiniry reports.
items.content: European countries held an emergency meeting in Brussels Sunday in response to President Trump's post threatening tariffs against countries that have sent military forces into Greenland amid his push to annex the Arctic island. Leigh Kiniry reports.

items.title: 1,500 soldiers placed on standby for possible deployment to Minneapolis
items.standfirst: A U.S. defense official confirmed some 1,500 active-duty soldiers, currently stationed in Alaska, are on standby for possible deployment to Minneapolis amid the city's protests.
items.content: A U.S. defense official confirmed some 1,500 active-duty soldiers, currently stationed in Alaska, are on standby for possible deployment to Minneapolis amid the city's protests.

items.title: Active-duty soldiers put on standby as Minneapolis ICE protests continue
items.standfirst: Soldiers with the 11th airborne unit based in Fairbanks, Alaska, are on standby for possible deployment to Minneapolis as protests against ICE operations continue in the city, a U.S. defense official confirmed to CBS News. Ian Lee reports.
items.content: Soldiers with the 11th airborne unit based in Fairbanks, Alaska, are on standby for possible deployment to Minneapolis as protests against ICE operations continue in the city, a U.S. defense official confirmed to CBS News. Ian Lee reports.

items.title: Pentagon readies 1,500 troops for potential Minnesota deployment, officials say
items.standfirst: US army issues prepare-to-deploy orders amid tension over ICE killing, though it is unclear if units will be sentThe Pentagon has ordered about 1,500 active-duty soldiers in Alaska to prepare for a possible deployment to Minnesota, the site of large protests against the government’s deportation drive, two US officials told Reuters on Sunday.The US army placed the units on prepare-to-deploy orders in case violence in the midwestern state escalates, the officials said, though it is not clear whether any of them will be sent. Continue reading...
items.content: US army issues prepare-to-deploy orders amid tension over ICE killing, though it is unclear if units will be sentThe Pentagon has ordered about 1,500 active-duty soldiers in Alaska to prepare for a possible deployment to Minnesota, the site of large protests against the government’s deportation drive, two US officials told Reuters on Sunday.The US army placed the units on prepare-to-deploy orders in case violence in the midwestern state escalates, the officials said, though it is not clear whether any of them will be sent. Continue reading...

items.title: Tariffs on Nato allies are wrong, Starmer tells Trump in Greenland crisis call
items.standfirst: UK prime minister holds phone call with US president as European leaders scramble to protect Danish territoryKeir Starmer has told Donald Trump he is wrong to threaten tariffs against Nato allies to try to secure Greenland, as part of a flurry of diplomatic calls intended to tackle the crisis.The UK prime minister spoke to the US president on Sunday, as well as to Mette Frederiksen, the Danish PM, whose country’s territory includes Greenland; Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission; and Mark Rutte, the Nato secretary general. Continue reading...
items.content: UK prime minister holds phone call with US president as European leaders scramble to protect Danish territoryKeir Starmer has told Donald Trump he is wrong to threaten tariffs against Nato allies to try to secure Greenland, as part of a flurry of diplomatic calls intended to tackle the crisis.The UK prime minister spoke to the US president on Sunday, as well as to Mette Frederiksen, the Danish PM, whose country’s territory includes Greenland; Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission; and Mark Rutte, the Nato secretary general. Continue reading...

items.content: Europe is split between hitting back at Trump's tariff threat or holding fire to avoid a damaging trade war.

items.content: The troops are an option should Donald Trump decide to use them to quell anti-ICE protests in the city, an official tells CBS News.

items.title: Hundreds of soldiers on standby for possible deployment to Minneapolis amid protests
items.standfirst: About 1,500 active-duty soldiers are on standby in Alaska for possible deployment to Minneapolis, a U.S. defense official told CBS News Saturday.
items.content: About 1,500 active-duty soldiers are on standby in Alaska for possible deployment to Minneapolis, a U.S. defense official told CBS News Saturday.

items.title: European leaders warn Trump's Greenland tariffs threaten 'dangerous downward spiral'
items.standfirst: In a joint statement, leaders of eight countries said they stand in "full solidarity" with Denmark and Greenland. Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen added: "Europe will not be blackmailed."
items.content: In a joint statement, leaders of eight countries said they stand in "full solidarity" with Denmark and Greenland. Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen added: "Europe will not be blackmailed."(Image credit: Geert Vanden Wijngaert)

items.title: Western alliance hangs in balance as Europe stiffens itself against Trump’s threats
items.standfirst: US demand to own Greenland leaves little scope for compromise, and forcing the issue would entail end of NatoGreenland, with a population of fewer than 57,000, might not seem to be the territory on which the future of the relationship between Europe and the US, the viability of Nato as the world’s most successful defence alliance, or even the fractured relations between the UK and Europe would be determined.But battlefields are sometimes the product of chance, rather than choice. It now feels as if Donald Trump’s threat to impose 10% tariffs on eight fellow Nato states for sending troops last week to support Greenland’s sovereignty may be one of those clarifying moments in which Europe had no option. Successive European leaders condemned Trump’s blackmail and intimidation on Sunday and they sounded as if they meant it. Continue reading...
items.content: US demand to own Greenland leaves little scope for compromise, and forcing the issue would entail end of NatoGreenland, with a population of fewer than 57,000, might not seem to be the territory on which the future of the relationship between Europe and the US, the viability of Nato as the world’s most successful defence alliance, or even the fractured relations between the UK and Europe would be determined.But battlefields are sometimes the product of chance, rather than choice. It now feels as if Donald Trump’s threat to impose 10% tariffs on eight fellow Nato states for sending troops last week to support Greenland’s sovereignty may be one of those clarifying moments in which Europe had no option. Successive European leaders condemned Trump’s blackmail and intimidation on Sunday and they sounded as if they meant it. Continue reading...

items.title: How can Europe respond to Trump's tariff threats over Greenland?
items.standfirst: FRANCE 24 Brussels correspondent Pierre Benazet talks about the closed-door crisis meeting between ambassadors from all 27 European Union members following US President Donald Trump's decision to slap tariffs on eight nations accused of opposing his efforts to annex the Danish autonomous territory of Greenland.
items.content: FRANCE 24 Brussels correspondent Pierre Benazet talks about the closed-door crisis meeting between ambassadors from all 27 European Union members following US President Donald Trump's decision to slap tariffs on eight nations accused of opposing his efforts to annex the Danish autonomous territory of Greenland.

items.title: Trump announces new tariffs over Greenland: How have EU allies responded?
items.standfirst: The European Union is having an emergency meeting to devise a response to Trump's tariff threats over Greenland.
items.content: The European Union is having an emergency meeting to devise a response to Trump's tariff threats over Greenland.

items.title: European governments condemn Trump's tariff threats over Greenland
items.standfirst: European governments blasted US President Donald Trump’s announcement that eight countries will face 10% tariff for opposing American control of Greenland beginning next month. Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland are on Trump's list, though it was not immediately clear if the tariffs would impact the European Union as a bloc.
items.content: European governments blasted US President Donald Trump’s announcement that eight countries will face 10% tariff for opposing American control of Greenland beginning next month. Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland are on Trump's list, though it was not immediately clear if the tariffs would impact the European Union as a bloc.

items.title: EU leaders to hold extraordinary summit on Trump’s Greenland tariffs ‘in coming days’
items.standfirst: European Council President Antonio Costa on Sunday said EU leaders would meet in the coming days to discuss US President Donald Trump's tariffs threat against eight nations opposing US control of the autonomous Danish territory of Greenland. The Financial Times reported that Europe is considering €93 billion worth of retaliatory tariffs against the US. Read our blog to see how the day's events unfolded.
items.content: European Council President Antonio Costa on Sunday said EU leaders would meet in the coming days to discuss US President Donald Trump's tariffs threat against eight nations opposing US control of the autonomous Danish territory of Greenland. The Financial Times reported that Europe is considering €93 billion worth of retaliatory tariffs against the US. Read our blog to see how the day's events unfolded.

items.title: Trump’s Tariff Threats Over Greenland
items.standfirst: The US president plans more tariffs on countries against his proposed Greenland takeover.
items.content: The US president plans more tariffs on countries against his proposed Greenland takeover.

items.title: Trump tariff threats over Greenland prompt calls for unprecedented EU counter-measures
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron will ask the EU to activate its "anti-coercion" measure – dubbed its trade “bazooka” – for the first time ever if US President Donald Trump follows through with threats to impose new tariffs on European countries for opposing his plans for Greenland. An extraordinary meeting of EU ambassadors has been called for Sunday afternoon in Brussels.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron will ask the EU to activate its "anti-coercion" measure – dubbed its trade “bazooka” – for the first time ever if US President Donald Trump follows through with threats to impose new tariffs on European countries for opposing his plans for Greenland. An extraordinary meeting of EU ambassadors has been called for Sunday afternoon in Brussels.

items.title: 'Dangerous downward spiral': Europe hits back at Trump tariff threat over Greenland
items.standfirst: The eight European countries targeted by US President Donald Trump with rising tariffs for opposing his plans to annex Greenland hit back at the president, saying they "stand united" against Washington's threats. The European Council will call an extraordinary summit of European leaders to discuss the situation in the days to come.
items.content: The eight European countries targeted by US President Donald Trump with rising tariffs for opposing his plans to annex Greenland hit back at the president, saying they "stand united" against Washington's threats. The European Council will call an extraordinary summit of European leaders to discuss the situation in the days to come.

items.title: Trump hits Denmark and 7 other U.S. allies with tariffs, escalating standoff over Greenland
items.standfirst: President Trump announced Saturday he would impose a 10% tariff starting Feb. 1 on all goods from Denmark and seven other European countries until a deal is in place allowing the U.S. to buy Greenland. Trump says the tariff will increase to 25% on June 1 for the eight NATO allies if no deal is reached. NBC News’ Melanie Zanona reports.
items.content: President Trump announced Saturday he would impose a 10% tariff starting Feb. 1 on all goods from Denmark and seven other European countries until a deal is in place allowing the U.S. to buy Greenland. Trump says the tariff will increase to 25% on June 1 for the eight NATO allies if no deal is reached. NBC News’ Melanie Zanona reports.

items.title: Trump threatens 25% tariff on European allies until Denmark sells Greenland to US
items.standfirst: Heads of state across Europe respond in solidarity with Denmark and Greenland, and boycott of World Cup suggestedDonald Trump threatened a 25% tariff on a slew of European countries including Denmark, Germany, France and the UK – until the US is allowed to purchase Greenland, in an extraordinary escalation of the president’s bid to claim the autonomous Danish territory.In a lengthy post on Saturday on Truth Social, Trump said he would impose a 10% tariff on Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland beginning 1 February, “on any and all goods sent to the United States of America”. Continue reading...
items.content: Heads of state across Europe respond in solidarity with Denmark and Greenland, and boycott of World Cup suggestedDonald Trump threatened a 25% tariff on a slew of European countries including Denmark, Germany, France and the UK – until the US is allowed to purchase Greenland, in an extraordinary escalation of the president’s bid to claim the autonomous Danish territory.In a lengthy post on Saturday on Truth Social, Trump said he would impose a 10% tariff on Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland beginning 1 February, “on any and all goods sent to the United States of America”. Continue reading...

items.title: High-speed train collision in Spain kills at least 39
items.standfirst: More than 400 passengers were on board the trains that derailed near the city of Córdoba in Spain's worst rail crash in more than a decade.

items.title: High-speed train crash in southern Spain leaves 39 dead
items.standfirst: Another 75 people hospitalised, officials say, after two trains collide and derail near Adamuz in Cordóba provinceAt least 39 people have been killed and 24 others seriously injured after two trains collided in southern Spain on Sunday night in what the prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, called “a night of deep pain for our country”.A high-speed Iryo train travelling from Málaga to Madrid derailed near the municipality of Adamuz in Córdoba province, crossing on to the other track where it hit an oncoming train, Adif, Spain’s rail infrastructure authority, posted on X. Continue reading...

items.content: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa plans to meet SDF chief Mazloum Abdi in Damascus on Monday.

items.title: Syrian government announces a ceasefire with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces
items.standfirst: The Syrian government has announced a ceasefire with the Syrian Democratic Forces, taking almost full control of the country
items.content: The Syrian government has announced a ceasefire with the Syrian Democratic Forces, taking almost full control of the country

items.title: Syria president claims ‘victory for all’ as ceasefire with Kurdish-led force announced
items.standfirst: Government’s truce with Syrian Democratic Forces follows advance on Kurdish-held areas amid struggle to control entire countryThe Syrian government on Sunday announced a ceasefire with the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), taking almost full control of the country and dismantling the Kurdish-led forces that controlled the north-east for over a decade.The announcement comes as tensions between government forces and the SDF boiled over earlier this month, eventually resulting in a major push by government forces towards the east. The SDF appeared to have largely retreated after initial clashes on a tense frontline area in eastern Aleppo province. Continue reading...
items.content: Government’s truce with Syrian Democratic Forces follows advance on Kurdish-held areas amid struggle to control entire countryThe Syrian government on Sunday announced a ceasefire with the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), taking almost full control of the country and dismantling the Kurdish-led forces that controlled the north-east for over a decade.The announcement comes as tensions between government forces and the SDF boiled over earlier this month, eventually resulting in a major push by government forces towards the east. The SDF appeared to have largely retreated after initial clashes on a tense frontline area in eastern Aleppo province. Continue reading...

items.title: Syria agrees ceasefire with Kurdish-led forces after two weeks of clashes

items.content: President Ahmed al-Sharaa said the deal would allow the Syrian state to reassert control over most areas.

items.title: Syrian government announces a ceasefire with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces

items.content: Syria's new leaders, since toppling Bashar Assad in December 2024, have struggled to assert their full authority over the war-torn country.(Image credit: Ghaith Alsayed)

items.title: Syria's government says it has struck ceasefire deal with Kurdish-led forces
items.standfirst: Damascus on Sunday announced a ceasefire deal with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) as Syrian troops continued a deadly advance through Kurdish-held territories in the country's northeast. The deal would see SDF forces merged into the government's defence and interior ministries.
items.content: Damascus on Sunday announced a ceasefire deal with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) as Syrian troops continued a deadly advance through Kurdish-held territories in the country's northeast. The deal would see SDF forces merged into the government's defence and interior ministries.

items.title: Syria announces ceasefire agreement with Kurd-led SDF after heavy fighting
items.standfirst: Agreement will see government takeover of SDF-controlled areas, and SDF integration into Syrian military.
items.content: Agreement will see government takeover of SDF-controlled areas, and SDF integration into Syrian military.

items.title: Kurdish forces risk turning to 'guerrilla' warfare as Syrian army advances
items.standfirst: Kurdish-led forces withdrew from Syria's largest oil field on Sunday, according to a conflict monitor, as government troops expanded their control over vast areas in the country's north and east. As the Syrian army continues to advance into Kurdish-held territories, the Kurdish forces may resort to guerrilla warfare, potentially destabilizing the country, said Henri Barkey, Professor of International Relations at Lehigh University.
items.content: Kurdish-led forces withdrew from Syria's largest oil field on Sunday, according to a conflict monitor, as government troops expanded their control over vast areas in the country's north and east. As the Syrian army continues to advance into Kurdish-held territories, the Kurdish forces may resort to guerrilla warfare, potentially destabilizing the country, said Henri Barkey, Professor of International Relations at Lehigh University.

items.content: A ceasefire has been declared between Syrian government troops and US-backed Kurdish-led forces, according to state media.

items.title: Guatemala Declares State of Siege After Gang Attacks Kill 7 Police Officers

items.content: Guatemalan President Bernardo Arévalo declared a 30-day state of siege following gang attacks that killed seven police officers.

items.title: 8 police officers killed in Guatemala after prison crackdown on gangs
items.standfirst: The killings occurred a day after gang member inmates took 46 people hostage in three prisons across the country, officials said.
items.content: The killings occurred a day after gang member inmates took 46 people hostage in three prisons across the country, officials said.

items.title: Guatemala says gangs killed seven police in retaliation over prison transfers
items.standfirst: Guatemala’s interior minister said gangs killed seven police officers on Sunday in retaliation for the government’s refusal to move gang leaders to a lower-security prison. The attacks followed the taking of 46 hostages by gang-linked inmates in three prisons. Authorities said control of one facility was restored.
items.content: Guatemala’s interior minister said gangs killed seven police officers on Sunday in retaliation for the government’s refusal to move gang leaders to a lower-security prison. The attacks followed the taking of 46 hostages by gang-linked inmates in three prisons. Authorities said control of one facility was restored.

clusters.title: Iran's president says any attack on Supreme Leader Khamenei would be declaration of war
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran warns attack on Khamenei would be declaration of war

items.title: Iran's president says any attack on Supreme Leader Khamenei would be declaration of war
items.standfirst: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian warned on Sunday that any attack on the country's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei would be tantamount to war. US President Donald Trump had on Saturday described the ayatollah as "a sick man", saying it was "time to look for new leadership in Iran".
items.content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian warned on Sunday that any attack on the country's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei would be tantamount to war. US President Donald Trump had on Saturday described the ayatollah as "a sick man", saying it was "time to look for new leadership in Iran".

items.title: Iran warns attack on Khamenei would be declaration of war
items.standfirst: President issues warning amid speculation Donald Trump plans to assassinate or remove supreme leaderIran’s president, Masoud Pezeshkian, warned on Sunday that any attack on the country’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, would be a declaration of war.In an apparent response to speculation that Donald Trump is considering an attempt to assassinate or remove Khamenei, Pezeshkian said in a post on X: “An attack on the great leader of our country is tantamount to a full-scale war with the Iranian nation.” Continue reading...
items.content: President issues warning amid speculation Donald Trump plans to assassinate or remove supreme leaderIran’s president, Masoud Pezeshkian, warned on Sunday that any attack on the country’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, would be a declaration of war.In an apparent response to speculation that Donald Trump is considering an attempt to assassinate or remove Khamenei, Pezeshkian said in a post on X: “An attack on the great leader of our country is tantamount to a full-scale war with the Iranian nation.” Continue reading...

items.title: Iran’s leader acknowledges thousands of deaths in protests, denies responsibility
items.standfirst: In an escalating war of words, Iran’s Supreme Leader called President Trump a criminal and blamed him for weeks of protests. President Trump called for new leadership in Iran. NBC News’ Molly Hunter has the latest.
items.content: In an escalating war of words, Iran’s Supreme Leader called President Trump a criminal and blamed him for weeks of protests. President Trump called for new leadership in Iran. NBC News’ Molly Hunter has the latest.

items.title: Trump calls for new leadership in Iran following nationwide protests

items.content: President Donald Trump on Saturday called for regime change in Iran following protests that have roiled the country in recent weeks.“It’s time to look for new leadership in Iran,” Trump told Politico in an interview

items.title: Hard-right populist wins a place in a two-way runoff in Portugal’s presidential election
items.standfirst: André Ventura, the leader of Portugal's hard-right Chega party, has placed second in the country's presidential election
items.content: André Ventura, the leader of Portugal's hard-right Chega party, has placed second in the country's presidential election

items.title: Portugal's centre-left Seguro to face far-right rival Ventura in presidential runoff
items.standfirst: Portugal’s Socialist candidate António José Seguro won the first round of the presidential election and will face far-right rival André Ventura in a runoff for the presidency, near-complete results showed on Sunday. With 95 percent of the vote counted, Seguro led with 30.6 percent, ahead of Ventura with 24.2 percent.
items.content: Portugal’s Socialist candidate António José Seguro won the first round of the presidential election and will face far-right rival André Ventura in a runoff for the presidency, near-complete results showed on Sunday. With 95 percent of the vote counted, Seguro led with 30.6 percent, ahead of Ventura with 24.2 percent.

items.title: Socialist to face far-right candidate for Portugal’s presidency
items.standfirst: Portugal's socialist candidate Antonio Jose Seguro won the first round of the presidential election
items.content: Portugal's socialist candidate Antonio Jose Seguro won the first round of the presidential election

items.title: Portugal presidential election: Socialist party’s Seguro to face far-right leader in runoff
items.standfirst: Moderate socialist Antonio Jose Seguro came out on top in the first round, followed by Andre Ventura of the far-right Chega partyModerate socialist Antonio Jose Seguro came out on top in the first round of Portugal’s presidential election on Sunday, followed by the far-right leader Andre Ventura, and the two will face off in a runoff on 8 February.In the five decades since Portugal threw off its fascist dictatorship, a presidential election has only once before required a runoff – in 1986 – highlighting how fragmented the political landscape has become with the rise of the far right and voter disenchantment with mainstream parties. Continue reading...
items.content: Moderate socialist Antonio Jose Seguro came out on top in the first round, followed by Andre Ventura of the far-right Chega partyModerate socialist Antonio Jose Seguro came out on top in the first round of Portugal’s presidential election on Sunday, followed by the far-right leader Andre Ventura, and the two will face off in a runoff on 8 February.In the five decades since Portugal threw off its fascist dictatorship, a presidential election has only once before required a runoff – in 1986 – highlighting how fragmented the political landscape has become with the rise of the far right and voter disenchantment with mainstream parties. Continue reading...

items.title: Portugal votes in tight presidential race with far right expected to reach runoff
items.standfirst: Opinion polls in Portugal show that far-right candidate Andre Ventura could win 24 percent, closely followed by Socialist Antonio Jose Seguro, FRANCE 24's Sarah Morris said. Portugal is holding what may be the first round of presidential elections on Sunday. In the five decades since ‍Portugal threw off its fascist dictatorship, a presidential election has only once before - in 1986 - required a runoff,
items.content: Opinion polls in Portugal show that far-right candidate Andre Ventura could win 24 percent, closely followed by Socialist Antonio Jose Seguro, FRANCE 24's Sarah Morris said. clusters.neutral_headline: Senegal stun hosts Morocco to win AFCON title

items.title: Senegal stun hosts Morocco to win AFCON title
items.standfirst: Senegal edge chaotic AFCON final as Gueye punishes penalty miss by Diaz to beat hosts Morocco 1-0 in extra time.
items.content: Senegal edge chaotic AFCON final as Gueye punishes penalty miss by Diaz to beat hosts Morocco 1-0 in extra time.

items.title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
items.standfirst: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations for a second time - but only after the final was overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play after the hosts are awarded a controversial stoppage time-penalty with the match 0-0.
items.content: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations for a second time - but only after the final was overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play after the hosts are awarded a controversial stoppage time-penalty with the match 0-0.

items.title: AFCON 2025: Senegal stun hosts Morocco to win final in chaotic finish
items.standfirst: Senegal shocked hosts Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations final 1-0 on Sunday, Pape Gueye scoring in extra time after a chaotic finish. Morocco missed a stoppage-time penalty when Brahim Diaz’s chipped effort was easily saved by goalkeeper Edouard Mendy following lengthy protests and disorder.
items.content: Senegal shocked hosts Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations final 1-0 on Sunday, Pape Gueye scoring in extra time after a chaotic finish. Morocco missed a stoppage-time penalty when Brahim Diaz’s chipped effort was easily saved by goalkeeper Edouard Mendy following lengthy protests and disorder.

items.title: Senegal beat Morocco 1-0 in chaotic AFCON 2025 final
items.standfirst: A freak final, as Senegal players walk-off the pitch after Morocco were awarded a last-minute penalty. Brahim Diaz saw his attempt of a panenka saved, only for Pape Gueye to score the winning goal in extra time as Senegal lifted the trophy (1-0) for the second time.
items.content: A freak final, as Senegal players walk-off the pitch after Morocco were awarded a last-minute penalty. Brahim Diaz saw his attempt of a panenka saved, only for Pape Gueye to score the winning goal in extra time as Senegal lifted the trophy (1-0) for the second time.

items.title: Senegal beat hosts Morocco to win AFCON 2025 after farcical walk-off
items.standfirst: Pape Gueye scores in a 1-0 win following extra time after Senegal leave the field in protest at penalty decision.
items.content: Pape Gueye scores in a 1-0 win following extra time after Senegal leave the field in protest at penalty decision.

items.title: CBS finally airs 60 Minutes segment on Venezuelan prisoners sent to Cecot in El Salvador
items.standfirst: The segment, reported by Sharyn Alfonsi, was supposed to air on 21 December but was pulled by editor in chief Bari WeissNearly a month after CBS News editor in chief Bari Weiss ignited controversy by shelving a 60 Minutes segment about Venezuelan prisoners, telling staffers that it needed more reporting, the piece finally aired on Sunday night.Weiss had originally instructed 60 Minutes to hold the segment about the Cecot prison in El Salvador, which had already been scheduled, in part because it lacked “the administration’s argument”. items.title: Surging billionaire wealth a political threat, Oxfam warns as Davos opens
items.standfirst: The collective wealth of the planet’s billionaires soared to a record level in 2025, warning of political consequences as the global elite gathers for the World Economic Forum.
items.content: The collective wealth of the planet’s billionaires soared to a record level in 2025, warning of political consequences as the global elite gathers for the World Economic Forum.

items.title: Billionaires’ wealth hits record in 2025, Oxfam warns of 'dangerous' political risks ahead of Davos
items.standfirst: The world’s billionaires grew richer than ever in 2025, charity Oxfam said on Monday, warning of “highly dangerous” political consequences as elites gather at the World Economic Forum in Davos. It said US President Donald Trump’s policies helped boost billionaire wealth 16.2% to $18.3 trillion in his second term’s first year.
items.content: The world’s billionaires grew richer than ever in 2025, charity Oxfam said on Monday, warning of “highly dangerous” political consequences as elites gather at the World Economic Forum in Davos. It said US President Donald Trump’s policies helped boost billionaire wealth 16.2% to $18.3 trillion in his second term’s first year.

clusters.title: PhilTower’s $1 Billion Sale Plan Is Said to Stall on Valuation
clusters.neutral_headline: PhilTower’s $1 Billion Sale Plan Is Said to Stall on Valuation

items.title: PhilTower’s $1 Billion Sale Plan Is Said to Stall on Valuation
PhilTower’s $1 Billion Sale Plan Is Said to Stall on Valuation
items.standfirst: A sale of PhilTower has stalled because of differences in views between shareholders and potential buyers about the company’s valuation, according to people familiar with the matter.
items.content: A sale of PhilTower has stalled because of differences in views between shareholders and potential buyers about the company’s valuation, according to people familiar with the matter.

clusters.title: 'Experienced terrorist' with links to deadly ambush killed by US strike
clusters.neutral_headline: 'Experienced terrorist' with links to deadly ambush killed by US strike

items.title: 'Experienced terrorist' with links to deadly ambush killed by US strike
items.standfirst: An "experienced terrorist leader" with ties to al Qaeda has been killed in US strikes, after an Islamic State ambush last month left three Americans dead.
items.content: An "experienced terrorist leader" with ties to al Qaeda has been killed in US strikes, after an Islamic State ambush last month left three Americans dead.

items.title: U.S. military says it killed Al Qaeda affiliate leader in northwest Syria
items.standfirst: U.S. forces conducted a strike in northwest Syria on Friday that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda affiliate leader who was tied to an ISIS shooter who ambushed and killed Americans last month, officials said.U.S.
items.content: U.S. forces conducted a strike in northwest Syria on Friday that resulted in the death of an Al Qaeda affiliate leader who was tied to an ISIS shooter who ambushed and killed Americans last month, officials said.U.S.

clusters.title: Ugandan election a 'fraudulent affair', Bobi Wine's lawyer says - as protesters face violent crackdown
clusters.neutral_headline: What a seventh term for 81-year-old leader means for Uganda

items.title: Ugandan election a 'fraudulent affair', Bobi Wine's lawyer says - as protesters face violent crackdown
items.standfirst: President Yoweri Museveni has extended his 40-year reign over Uganda by another five years.
items.content: President Yoweri Museveni has extended his 40-year reign over Uganda by another five years.

items.title: What a seventh term for 81-year-old leader means for Uganda
items.standfirst: Yoweri Museveni has won a record seventh term in elections after promising that the fledgling oil sector will boost the economy.
items.content: Yoweri Museveni has won a record seventh term in elections after promising that the fledgling oil sector will boost the economy.

items.title: Ugandan leader extends 40-year rule after winning contested poll
items.standfirst: President Yoweri Museveni wins a seventh term, as his main rival Bobi Wine decries "fake results".
items.content: President Yoweri Museveni wins a seventh term, as his main rival Bobi Wine decries "fake results".
